data: If patient is unable to give informed consent, please arrange for a family member/legal guardian to accompany patient to radiology dept.
Bilateral lower extremities, once, pre-procedure baseline
Left lower extremity, once, pre-procedure baseline
Right lower extremity, once, pre-procedure baseline
Bilateral upper extremities, once, Pre-procedure baseline, if radial access required
Left upper extremity, once, Pre-procedure baseline, if radial access required
Right upper extremity, once, Pre-procedure baseline, if radial access required
Left upper extremity, Check fistula for bruit and thrill
Right upper extremity, Check fistula for bruit and thrill
6 hours pre-procedure, may take medications with sips of water
6 hour pre-procedure, no solids, may have clear fluids up to 2 hrs pre-procedure
May have clear fluids after midnight until 0600, and then nothing to eat day of procedure
Except for Medications, With sips of water, NPO from midnight pre-procedure
order rate: 75 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag

For patients on anticoagulants refer to Management Guidelines for Patients having elective Invasive Procedures in Medical Imaging
Notify the Interventional Radiologist or Radiology Dept, if routine anticoagulation / antiplatelet therapy has NOT been discontinued as per Management Guidelines
1 mg, sublingual, pre-procedure, PRN anxiety, drug form: tab-sublingual
dose range: 325 to 975 mg, PO, pre-procedure, PRN pain, drug form: tab
dose range: 325 to 975 mg, NG-tube, pre-procedure, PRN pain, drug form: tab
dose range: 325 to 975 mg, NG-tube, pre-procedure, PRN pain, drug form: tab
1,300 mg, rectal, pre-procedure, drug form: supp

50 mg, PO, pre-procedure, drug form: tab-EC
100 mg, rectal, pre-procedure, drug form: supp
dose range: 4 to 8 mg, IV, once, PRN nausea or vomiting,  drug form: inj
dose range: 4 to 8 mg, PO, once, PRN nausea or vomiting, drug form: tab
150 mcg, subcutaneous, once, drug form: inj, first dose: STAT
octreotide continuous infusion (5 mcg/mL) in NS standard

ceFAZolin can be safely administered to patients with penicillin allergy, including anaphylaxis. Do NOT administer if severe delayed skin reaction to any beta-lactam (e.g. drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms, Stevens-Johnson syndrome, toxic epidermal necrolysis)
1,000 mg, IV, pre-procedure, drug form: bag [Less Than 80 kg]
2,000 mg, IV, pre-procedure, drug form: bag [80 - 121 kg]
3,000 mg, IV, pre-procedure, drug form: bag [Greater Than or Equal To 121 kg]
2,000 mg, IV, pre-procedure, drug form: bag
1500 mg, IV, pre-procedure [Greater Than or Equal To 80 kg]
Liver embolization: select [ceFAZolin AND metroNIDAZOLE] OR [tobramycin AND metroNIDAZOLE]
500 mg, IV, pre-procedure, drug form: bag
5 mg/kg, IV, pre-procedure, drug form: inj
amoxicillin-clavulanate 875 mg-125 mg tab (dosed as amoxicillin)
875 mg, PO, pre-procedure, drug form: tab
cotrimoxazole DS 800 mg-160 mg tab (dosed as trimethoprim)
160 mg, (trimethoprim 160 mg = 1 DS tab), PO, pre-procedure, drug form: tab
500 mg, PO, pre-procedure, drug form: tab
100 mg, PO, pre-procedure, drug form: cap
Refer to Management Guidelines for Patients Having *ELECTIVE* Invasive Procedures in Medical Imaging
Lab work to be done within 30 days prior to admission for outpatients and within 72 hours for inpatients
Liver Panel (Bilirubin, ALP, Alb, ALT, GGT)
Urinalysis Macroscopic (dipstick) with Microscopic if indicated
Order Electrocardiogram if patient is 50 years or older
Do not proceed with local injection in ectopic pregnancy, if evidence of rupture or hemoperitoneum present on ultrasound
Consider consultation with Thrombosis clinic, Surgery, Acute Pain Services and Anaesthesiology
IR Prevention of Contrast Induced Nephropathy (CIN) (Module)
IR Gastrostomy / Gastrojejunostomy Tube Insertion Pre Procedure (Module)
